name: Coalition of European Organisations on Data Protection
goal:
The Coalition of European organisations on Data Protection gives voice to concerns that European companies and organisations have with respect to the draft General Data Protection Regulation, since some of its provisions may severely hinder EU industrial operations on the global market with negative effects for competitiveness.

The Coalition is made up of 20 European organisations, from SMEs to global multinationals and non-profit organisations operating in a variety of sectors, on national, regional and global scale. With an aggregated turnover of over ? 120 billion and some 607,000 employees worldwide, our footprint allows us to bring growth, progress and jobs to the EU?s economy.

The Coalition members are:
- ABB
- Atlas Copco
- Barncancerfonden
- Electrolux
- Ericsson
- Husqvarna
- Investor
- Jajja Communications
- Klarna
- Nokia
- Sandvik
- SAP SE
- Scania
- Stora Enso
- Sonae
- U-tad - Centro Universitario de Tecnolog?a y Arte Digital
- Visma
- Volvo Group
- ZED
interests: Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
General Data Protection Regulation
Data Economy
International Data Transfers
